sentences.text: The election is being held amid a schism within the ruling Movimiento al Socialismo (MAS) between incumbent president Luis Arce and one of his predecessors, Evo Morales. The former allies fell out following Arce's 2020 Bolivian general election|election in 2020, when Morales, who had been in exile following 2019 Bolivian political crisis|political unrest caused by his 2019 Bolivian general election|reelection bid in 2019, returned from Mexico and tried to regain control of the party's leadership.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |last=Meakem |first=Allison |date=2 January 2025 |title=Elections to Watch in 2025 |url=https://foreignpolicy.com/2025/01/02/top-world-elections-2025-canada-germany-ecuador-australia-poland-bolivia/ |access-date=7 April 2025 |website=Foreign Policy |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: Right-leaning political parties formed a Unity Bloc to oppose Arce. Its candidates included Samuel Doria Medina and Jorge Quiroga|Jorge "Tuto" Quiroga. Meanwhile, Morales announced his intention to run under the Front for Victory (Bolivia)|Front for Victory (FPV) despite a ban on him running again for president by the Plurinational Constitutional Tribunal.
